poem:
Title: "Schrader's Reel"

Waking from cinematic dreams,
with Schrader's scenes flickering on my lashes,
each frame, an echo of yesterday's tale,
cementing stagnation's irrepressible rally.

Scorsese's dog, a rumour, a jest,
a thumb gnawed - merely ubiquitous lore,
while Oh, Canada rolls on the silver tongue,
lacing our morning's Common-Raven call.

In the Criterion's vault, Future anticipates,
under Schrader's uncompromised, unsparing gaze.
